definition: to gold-plate/to gild/(fig.) to make sth quite ordinary seem special
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: This gold-plated copper commemorative medallion has a diameter of 50mm.
sentences.chinese: 此枚纪念章为铜质镀金，直径50毫米。

sentences.english: Our factory features exquisite screen printing and high quality gold-plating.
sentences.chinese: 我厂具有优质旳丝网印刷与高质量旳镀金技术。

sentences.english: The sun transform the gild cupola into dazzling point of light.
sentences.chinese: 太阳将这些镀金的圆屋顶变成了闪耀的光点。

sentences.english: New materials such as gilded cobber and silvery threads emerged.
sentences.chinese: 例如，银镀金卡柏线程出现的新材料。

sentences.english: Unique and luxurious design with gold plated PCB, jacks and metal bracket.
sentences.chinese: 独特的设计和豪华镀金电路板，千斤顶和金属支架。

sentences.english: Be careful installing the gold cartridge clips to avoid damage to the clips or wires.
sentences.chinese: 小心安装镀金的唱头线夹避免损坏线夹或唱臂线。

sentences.english: The maturity of newspapering market was formed in the Gilded age.
sentences.chinese: 美国报业市场的孕育成熟是在镀金时代形成的。

sentences.english: Golden Temple and Tower, but you can get nothing gold from them.
sentences.chinese: 镀金的小庙和塔，就是你什么也扣不下来。

sentences.english: Bronze plated with gold and a smallish diamond.
Is golden boards used to check the AOI machine before the inspection of each shift?
sentences.chinese: 在每次换班前是否用AOI机器检验镀金板？

sentences.english: Gilding the lily leads to insanity.
sentences.chinese: 镀金百合将导致精神病。

sentences.english: Afine etched gilt German burgonet, probably Augsburg, ca. 1585.
sentences.chinese: 蚀刻镀金德国钢盔奥格斯堡1585。

sentences.english: The Golden Shadow crystal sparkles on a rose gold-plated chain.
sentences.chinese: 黄金影子玫瑰镀金链晶体闪烁。

sentences.english: The watch was only plated with gold.
It is made of bronze with gold on the outside.
sentences.chinese: 这尊雕像是用铜做的，外面镀金。

sentences.english: The lamp comes in gold-plated and chrome -plated versions.
sentences.chinese: 灯有镀金和镀铬的版本。

definition: the coating of sth that has been chrome-plated or copper-plated etc
variant of 鎦金|镏金[liu2 jin1]
brass (alloy of copper 銅|铜[tong2] and zinc 鋅|锌[xin1])
to gild/(old) wages paid to a performer or a troupe by a theater
to inlay/to embed/to set (e.g. a jewel in a ring)/tiling/tesselation
copper (pure copper, as opposed to alloy)
